source_caption_data.pre_caption: This is a static, wide-angle shot of the River Thames in London. The camera remains still, capturing a scenic view of the cityscape, including landmarks like the Shard and the "Walkie Talkie" building. The only movement comes from the gentle flow of the river and a few boats.
source_caption_data.pre_caption_prompt: The video is a scenery shot. You do not need to describe the subject motion. Just note that briefly in one to three sentences.
source_caption_data.initial_feedback: The movement includes the gentle flow of the river, the drifting clouds, a few boats and moving vehicles on the roads and bridge.
source_caption_data.gpt_feedback: The video captures not only the gentle flow of the river but also the drifting clouds, a few boats, and moving vehicles on the roads and bridge, adding subtle dynamism to the scene.
source_caption_data.final_feedback: The video captures not only the gentle flow of the river but also the drifting clouds, a few boats, and moving vehicles on the roads and bridge, adding subtle dynamism to the scene.
source_caption_data.gpt_caption: This is a static, wide-angle shot of the River Thames in London. The camera remains still, capturing a scenic view of the cityscape, including landmarks like the Shard and the "Walkie Talkie" building. The scene is brought to life by the gentle flow of the river, drifting clouds, a few boats, and moving vehicles on the roads and bridge, adding subtle dynamism to the view.
source_caption_data.final_caption: This is a static, wide-angle shot of the River Thames in London. The camera remains still, capturing a scenic view of the cityscape, including landmarks like the Shard and the "Walkie Talkie" building. The scene is brought to life by the gentle flow of the river, drifting clouds, a few boats, and moving vehicles on the roads and bridge, adding subtle dynamism to the view.

generated_critique: The caption correctly identifies the static nature of the shot and the general moving elements, but it lacks the specific detail required to accurately describe the motion. The phrase "a few boats" is too vague; in the video, a large, white-and-red passenger ferry moves steadily from the right side of the frame to the left, leaving a prominent wake on the water's surface, while a smaller, faster speedboat travels in the opposite direction closer to the far bank. Similarly, "moving vehicles on the roads and bridge" fails to capture the distinct, continuous flow of red double-decker buses and white vans crossing London Bridge from left to right in the background. The description of the river's "gentle flow" is also an oversimplification, as the video clearly shows the current creating small whirlpools around the bridge's support columns. A more precise description would detail the specific paths and types of the moving subjects, providing a much clearer representation of the scene's activity.
revised_caption_by_generated_critique: This is a static, wide-angle shot of the River Thames in London. The camera remains still, capturing a scenic view of the cityscape, including landmarks like the Shard and the "Walkie Talkie" building. A large, white-and-red passenger ferry moves steadily from the right side of the frame to the left, leaving a prominent wake on the water's surface, while a smaller, faster speedboat travels in the opposite direction closer to the far bank. In the background, a continuous flow of red double-decker buses and white vans crosses London Bridge from left to right. The river's current creates small whirlpools around the bridge's support columns, adding dynamic detail to the scene.
